entry.title: Rubyists on Rails - RubyKaigi 2023
entry.summary: RubyKaigi 2023 Wi-Fi & Rubyists on Rails Sponsor
entry.content:
Japanese follows English. æ—¥æœ¬èªã¯è‹±èªã«ç¶šãã¾ã™ã€‚

Rubyists on Rails (English)

Cookpad is putting Rubyists on Rails! Literally.
We've booked 2 train cars on the Azusa Limited Express from Shinjuku Station (Tokyo) to Matsumoto, where RubyKaigi is being held!

Schedule

  • 1st - Departs May 10th 8:00 am (Arrives in Matsumoto at 10:37 am)
  • 2nd - Departs May 10th 3:00 pm (Arrives in Matstumoto at 5:37 pm)

Both trains will depart from Shinjuku Station (13 min ride from Tokyo Station). Make sure to be early - Shinjuku is a monstrously complex station with the highest number of passengers per day in the world!
Participants should arrive on the platform at least 10 minutes prior of departure.

Fees/Charges

Tickets for the Rubyists on Rails train are FREE!

Registration

Registration will be open thru April 6th 11:59 pm JST.

RSVP from this Connpass page.
Please enter your email address on registration. We will check your email address with RubyKaigi organizing team (ruby-no-kai) to inquire whether or not you will be attending RubyKaigi 2023, so make sure to use the same email address you registered for RubyKaigi.

  • Rubyists on Rails participants must be registered for RubyKaigi 2023.
  • If we have received more applications than we have tickets for, participants will be decided by a lottery.
  • Seats will be randomly assigned.

Event Policies

Participants must abide by the following policies from RubyKaigi and Cookpad.

  • RubyKaigi 2023 Policies
  • Cookpad Event Policy (Japanese only)
  • It is similar to the RubyKaigi's anti-harassment policy. Use machine translation to read in English - sorry for inconvenience.

The event organizers will use entered information for organizing this event. Refer to Cookpad's privacy policy for further information.

Notes

  • Participants are responsible for their own belongings during the event. Cookpad Inc. cannot take any responsibility for theft, loss, or any other incidents that may occur during the event.
  • Due to unavoidable circumstances such as natural disasters, unforeseen accidents, or circumstances on the organizer's side, the content of the event may be changed or canceled on the day.
